sentences.english: The dry river – bed finds no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 枯竭的河床觉得无需向丰水期表示谢意。

sentences.english: We can give them a break, and help them avoid burnout.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以让他们休息一下并帮助他们避免精力枯竭。

sentences.english: Their supply of spices was well-nigh exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 他们的香料供应已经枯竭。

sentences.english: Natural resources are shrinking, degenerating and drying up.
sentences.chinese: 自然资源在萎缩，退化和枯竭。
停电，水源枯竭，油价上窜。

sentences.english: The three major U. S. auto giant is the cash flow is drying up and in serious danger together.
sentences.chinese: 美国的三大汽车巨头是现金流枯竭而举步危艰。

sentences.english: Iron stores in the body become depleted and haemoglobin synthesis is inhibited.
sentences.chinese: 铁店在体内成为枯竭和血红蛋白合成受到抑制。

sentences.english: As for existing spare parts on-site, to use as needed to depletion.
sentences.chinese: 至于现场现有的备件，根据需要使用枯竭。

sentences.english: The harvest has grown to maturity and starts to die.
sentences.chinese: 收获期已到了成熟阶段，并开始走向枯竭。
可是海也不会因此而枯竭。

sentences.english: The underground water was exhausted by incontinent use.
sentences.chinese: 翻译地下水由于无节制的使用而枯竭了。

sentences.english: Her ambitions had shrunk gradually in the desiccating air of failure.
sentences.chinese: 多少雄心壮志已在失败的阴影下逐渐枯竭了。

sentences.english: The insurgents' cartridges were giving out; but not their sarcasms .
sentences.chinese: 被包围者的子弹逐渐耗尽，他们的嘲讽却还没有枯竭。

sentences.english: In fact, the R&D pipeline for new antimicrobials has practically run dry.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，研发规划中新的抗菌药几乎已经枯竭。

sentences.english: Their sources of information have dried up.
sentences.chinese: 他们的信息来源枯竭了。

sentences.english: The dry river-bed finds no thanks for its past。
sentences.chinese: 枯竭的河床，并不感谢它的过去。

definition: to exhaust/to use up/to deplete/to drain
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
on the edge of/(fig.) on the verge of/close to
to be on the brink of/to be on the verge of
(of soil etc) to wash away/to be eroded/(fig.) (of talented staff, followers of a religious faith, investment funds etc) to go elsewhere/to fail to be retained
